sub_title: Professional Musician | Bachelor's in Turkish Ottoman Music
summary:
Dimitra Metzaki is a professional musician who specializes in oud, a traditional string instrument in modal music. She graduated from Codarts Rotterdam, one of the leading institutes for the arts in Europe, with a bachelor's degree in Turkish Ottoman Music in August 2023. She has studied with renowned teachers and masters, such as T.Atzakas, S.Sinopoulos, A.Papadimitrakis, K.Erguner, Y.Tokcan, N.Rohana, C.Barbas, C.Labrakis, and R.Daly.

Besides her passion for oud, Dimitra is also an experienced music teacher who has been giving lessons for six years. She teaches oud, Western and Turkish theory, repertoire and improvisation to students of all levels and ages. She also helps aspiring musicians prepare for a bachelor's degree in music. Additionally, Dimitra has performed at various festivals and concert halls across the Netherlands, Belgium, France, and Greece, including the prestigious North Sea Jazz Festival with her band, Merem, in July 2023. In September 2023, Merem are about to release their first album consisting of their compositions, lyrics and arrangements.

Dimitra's goal is to share her love and knowledge of modal music and oud with diverse audiences and learners.

school.name: Codarts Rotterdam | University of the Arts

profile_positions.description:
Merem was formed in Rotterdam in 2021 by the musicians Dimitra Metzaki (oud), Yiorgos Bereris (piano), Vanessa Kourtesi (vocals), Yiannis Vagianos (double bass), and Ektoras Remsak (drums). The artists crossed paths in Rotterdam while studying at Codarts Conservatory, and they are all currently based there.

United by their Greek heritage, the members felt a strong urge to create music deeply rooted in their home country's traditions, infused with jazz influences and a modern touch. Their musical style can be described as gentle, poetic, and vibrant, representing a fusion of jazz and traditional music elements.

Despite the challenges posed by lockdowns and the COVID-19 pandemic, the band started collaborating right away, recognizing a unique musical connection among them. Even during the restrictive period of the pandemic, they managed to compose new pieces that prominently incorporated Eastern musical elements.

Starting from November 2021, Merem embarked on a series of tours across the Netherlands, Western Europe, and Greece. Over the past year, they unveiled two singles: "Yiasemi" and "Athina," both composed and produced by the band members themselves. Their debut EP was recorded in March 2023, followed by the release of the single "Daripe" in June 2023, a precursor to their full album scheduled to drop in September 2023. The band also had the privilege of performing at the prestigious North Sea Jazz Festival in July 2023.
profile_positions.title: Oud player
